title: Introducing: WIld Paws
content:
These debut three tracks from LA’s Wild Paws are about as close to a definition of modern lo-fi as you’re going to get.

Plenty of echoed vocals and hazy shoegaze inspired guitar lines make for wonderfully romanticized tracks, that are more than worthy of repeated listens. Their self-titled EP is a collection of lovelorn tracks, written to soundtrack breaking up, making up and making out. Opener Pancakes is a five and a half minute epic, combining male and female vocals to glorious effect, with the two singers crooning ‘be my baby tonight‘.

There’s touches of The Pains Of Being Pure At Heart on Run, yet more spaced out and lethargic, relying heavily on the electronic percussion section. Despite it still being very early in Wild Paws career, this trio of tracks is more than enough to show the potential these guys have. Check out Pancakes below and head over to their bandcamp to hear the other two cuts.
author: 5e9b68b27a1236eccfeb1d27
